titleStmt.title: Description of Columbia University MS Or 19: Panjāh bāb-i sulṭānī bi-ʻilm-i usṭurlāb.

note: Title from p. [1] of the manuscript.

msContents.summary: On the use of the astrolabe in calendar making and astrology; ends abruptly; no colophon.

persName.#text: Āmulī, Rukn ibn Sharaf al-Dīn, active 1456

msItem.title: Panjāh bāb-i sulṭānī bi ʻilm-i usṭurlāb

supportDesc.extent: 42 bi-paginated leaves : 200 x 140 (165 x 110) mm, bound to 220 x 150 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Numbers in ink at the top of every other page, number 11 repeats. Catchwords every verso, lower left. References in the record are to the pagination as it appears in the manuscript.

layoutDesc.layout: 17 lines per page with some marginalia; frame-ruled.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in nastaʻliq in black ink.

decoNote: Section headers and overlines in red. Includes 7 tables: pp. [24], [32], 35, [36], 43, [54], [60], and 4 diagrams: pp. 25, [26], 27, 63.

binding.p: Islamic binding, sewn on two wide leather thongs. Full dark brown leather, blind tooled.

origin.p: Likely copied in Herat. The work is written on different types of paper including European laid paper and machine-made paper.

history.provenance: Presumed to be a gift of David Eugene Smith, 1931-1934.
